title.narrative: OEGI- Kenya Integrated Water Sanitation and Hygiene (KIWASH)

description.narrative: (Kenya): The purpose of the Kenya Integrated Water Sanitation and Hygiene activity is to help increase access of clean water, improved sanitation, and hygiene (WASH) to more than one million Kenyans. The activity will assist water service providers (WSPs) to expand household connections and extend networks to unserved communities. In rural areas, the activity will work with county officials, WSPs, and private entrepreneurs to expand and improve operations; and improve management of existing community drinking water systems. It will work with the Kenyan Water Resource Users Association to improve catchment area protection and water access, and improve sanitation and multi-use services. To improve access to sanitation services and reduce open defecation, the activity will work with counties that make strong commitments to apply the community-led total sanitation approach and engage with private sector providers to make access to household latrines/toilets more affordable. The activity will work through public health clinics and local organizations already active in the agricultural and health/nutrition sectors (community savings groups and community care groups), prioritizing locations with high percentages of malnourished or stunted children. The activity will integrate with other related USAID activities to complement and realize synergies.This activity will help the Government of Kenya and counties along it's journey to self-reliance by developing strategic planning skills, enhancing capacity, and better prioritizing WASH needs. Capacity enhancement for local staff is a key element to ensure sustainability upon project completion, which is important to achieving the U.S. government Mission Objective of improved governance and basic service provision. Providing access to water and sanitation in Kenya helps reduce conflict over resources, thus contributing to greater regional stability, a U.S. Foreign Policy priority.
